text:
Students turned violent when the police was removing a body that was found in a water tank on the campus.- Photo: G. Ramakrishna

Seven policemen were injured on Wednesday when they were pelted with stones by a group of students as they were taking out the body of a man found inside a water tank on the Osmania University (OU) campus, police said.

Two policemen suffered injuries on the head, Deputy Commissioner of Police (east zone), A. Ravindar said.

The students gathered in large numbers on learning that the body of a man was found in the water tank. They claimed that the deceased was a student and alleged that he had committed suicide. They demanded an inquiry. When the policemen were in the process of shifting the body for post mortem, the protesting students tried to prevent them.

“The students held a dharna, raised slogans and did not allow the police to shift the body despite being shown the identity card of the deceased that established that he was not a student,” Mr. Ravindar said.

“They later started pelting the police with stones. The protesters were dispersed and efforts are on to nab those who hurled the stones,” he said.

Body identified

Assistant Commissioner of Police (Kachiguda Division) Ch. Laxminaryana said the deceased was identified as a labourer. “He appears to be a drunkard and must have got inside the tank to cool himself... he apparently suffocated and drowned,” the ACP said.

Additional forces were deployed on the campus following the stone pelting incident. — PTI
title: Unrest in Osmania varsity, seven policemen injured
